Comment: OUCH! My finger slipped from a Scandinavian to the "awful" Pirc! I hate it because Korchnoy lost his almost historic turn-up in a world champion match with it.

Still not dangerous, but aiming at f7. I hate Pirc!

Targeting e4. He can easily defend it with f3, but it compromises a little his Kside. Not a problem, but he could have feared it. If e5, I'm prepared to play the exchange and accept QxQ and playing without castling. A Q move is also good for white, but he...
Just found it too juicy to make of my lsb a "blind" one. Now, a good idea can be Ba6. This forces white to exchange the b or condemn his to b3.
This can't be bad.
Uncovering his cards very quickly.
g5... not so easy. It can be interesting to own e5 a move more. I want to play Ne5, threatening the lsb, but I can't due to Bb5+. So I think that, even if it is not a developing move again,
g5... not so easy. It can be interesting to own e5 a move more. I want to play Ne5, threatening the lsb, but I can't due to Bb5+. So I think that, even if it is not a developing move again,
...is needed.
? White deprives his N from his best square for no reason. This indicates that white wants to move actions into the queenside: Bf2, Nc3 free to jump somewhere... can it be?
Some breath!
More space, please, more lines!
More space, please, more lines!
Ah, as I expected. Now I have to be very aware of sacs on the Qside.
Not great, but needed. I won't castle since white is well placed on both flankes and owns the center. I have to be very, very wise to survive.
f4 can't be played yes, because of Ne-g4, exchanging one of the two B. I could well have played Ng6, but I wanted to play g4.
Preventing Na4, with a possible sac on b6, and reinforcing g4 in case of f4. I can't play g4 myself now because after f4, my Ne4 has to retire to g6, and I didn't want to allow that, if possible.
Interesting. Now I know where my target is. My dsb is warming up. But in all this mess, I saw an interesting consecuence of the WK and Q's position, one players often overlook;
White can't play Qxg5, or Bh6 will win the WQ.
? White didn't calculate that after...
...the issue remains unvaried! f4 is untouchable, and if Kb1, I can defend it somehow.
